Name: NOBODY
Description:
Game includes rules for 4 classical rules of Draughts and the new game NOBODY. Gameplay is on a regular board of Chess/Draught. It`s a huge wooden board and big wooden pieces.
 One player starts on his first two rows filled with 16 playing pieces in one color. The other player has nothing and is called the NOBODY. One player has to move as much pieces as possible to the two rows of the opposite by using moves similar to Draught. In his turn Nobody can do nothing, or move a piece just one square, or make a special three-step-move to catch pieces by using the pawns of the other player.
Player with most pieces off or on the board wins.

—user summary

Name: RUN! The Card Game
Description:
RUN! is the card game in which players simulate hikers running from a ravenous grizzly bear. In order to win, you don’t need to be the fastest player—you just need to be faster than the slowest player!

Stay alive each round by being as quick as possible. The higher the point total in your hand each round, the faster you will be! Each player starts with three cards and three life chips. The game is played in rounds, with players taking turns picking up and discarding cards to try to achieve the best hand possible. Cards represent escape variables, ranging from -2 to +7. Once a player believes he has a winning hand, he hits the table and yells “RUN!”—at which point the remaining players take one last turn to try to improve their hands before concluding the round. Players then reveal their cards and use any Sabotage Cards or other Specialty Cards in their hand to trip up the other players and/or boost their own chances of survival. The player with the lowest (slowest) hand must feed a life chip to the hungry bear. Play continues in rounds until just one player is left standing and is declared the winner!

—description from the publisher

Name: Big Monster: Promo Tile
Description:
A promo monster tile given at FIJ in cannes (2020).

Grassland tile which can be used when the game is played in pair (2,4 or 6 players).
It gives 1 point for each grassland and swamp tile of the player and its teammate.

Name: TOP JOB Africa
Description:
TOP JOB is a card game where you team up professionals to launch businesses in 5 different industries. Team up a nurse, a surgeon, a cleaner and a manager and you have a hospital! But be careful... other players may try to steal your cards, hire your crew or send you to pay extra taxes!

Gather the best team following the needs of your Business Partner (personal goal card) and once a player has launched 3 businesses, it's time to score! The player with the highest victory points wins.

THE 1st GAME ABOUT BUSINESS
THAT’S ONLY ABOUT PEOPLE

—description from the publisher

Name: Trivial Pursuit: Rock & Pop Edition (Travel)
Description:
Part of the Parker Travel series.

A twp person (or team) travel version of Trivial Pursuit. The carrying case splits into tow halves, each containing 50 trivia cards, and an affixed scoring piece to hold eared wedges. It also includes a die with 6 colors on it, to randomly determine which question is next asked.

The categories are: Blue- Top of the Pops, Pink- Born in the USA, Yellow- Great British Hitmakers, Brown- Passing Fads, Green- No Number Ones, and Orange- Juke Box Jive.

Name: Vossa Excelência: Expansão Projeto de Poder
Description:
Vossa Excelência: Expansão Projeto de Poder (Your Excellency: The Power Project Expansion) is an expansion to the base game and will now support 3 more players! Additional rules introduce new game modes and guarantees huge replayability. It requires the base game in order to play.

45 new cards:


     6 new Politician cards
     6 new Party cards
     12 new parliamentary cards 
     6 new Infamy cards
     8 new Electorate cards
     1 "Speaker of the House" card 
     6 new Rule cards

Name: Vossa Excelência: Expansão Nova Era
Description:
The world is no longer the same, Your Excellency. Gone are the days when only money and the use of the public machine guaranteed re-election. With social media becoming popular, the old politics and power owners are being threatened by a bunch of kids and outsiders. The competition has become much tougher, more unpredictable, and any slip will be forever registered on the network. Get ready for an entirely different political game. Are you afraid, noble colleague? It's the New Age!

"Nova Era" brings the game "Your Excellency" to the Digital Age. The New Era of information is here! This expansion adds the Internet to the political game.

Adds 60 new cards:


     6 new Politician cards
     6 new Party cards (5 of them "ideological" parties)
     12 parliamentary cards 
     1 rules booklet
     6 new Electorate cards
     3 new Event cards
     21 new Internet cards 
     24 "Like" tokens

Name: Domhan Rhapsodie
Description:
To win, you must use a deck of 50 cards and play them strategically to win the 5 crystal shards of the opponent, one for each direct attack, once per turn.

As Guardian of the Veil, your mission is to obliterate your opponent with the help of warriors that come from all the Worlds that coexist on both sides of the Veil ... Do you have what it takes to conquer your enemies? This is Domhan Rhapsodie!

(Text by publisher)

Name: That Embattled Isle: Seven Battles from the History of England 60 AD to 1282 AD
Description:
That Embattled Isle 
is a set of seven detailed historical scenarios for De Bellis Antiquitatis (DBA 2.2.) that can be enjoyed as a set in a group or convention setting, or played one at a time by enthusiasts.

The battles trace a variety of foreign invasions of Britain and resistance against them from earliest recorded history with the Romans through the 13th century.

—description from the publisher

Name: Spelldancer: The Mage Wars – Fantasy Wargame Rules
Description:
Mage-wars 
is a fantasy wargame designed to work equally well in 15mm or 25-30mm.

Compatible with miniatures from a wide range of manufacturers and designed to give the players the freedom and flexibility to let their imaginations run free.

Tactics and formations play an important role in winning a battle, and will often swing the odds in favour of he more cunning player rather than the largest forces.

With an easy to use magic system and rules for customizing character models that will enable you to produce individual and unique heroes, mages and officers.

The rules can easily be used to fight small skirmishes of just a few models each up to massed battles between armies fielding thousands of troops.  
The discipline and morale rules enable well motivated, disciplined troops to fend off much larger but more poorly lead opponents.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: Adventures in Waterdeep Team Pack
Description:
Dice Masters is a global hit from WizKids that uses the proprietary Dice Building Game platform developed by Mike Elliott and Eric M. Lang. The Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: Adventures in Waterdeep Team Pack will be the most epic part of your collection!

The Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: Adventures in Waterdeep Team Pack features the most beloved characters of Waterdeep, including Brawlwin Chainminer, the Black Viper, Jarlaxle, Durnan, and several characters making their very first appearance in Dice Masters!

The Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: Adventures in Waterdeep Team Pack will let players build their own team of adventurers! The Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: Adventures in Waterdeep Team Pack is perfect for the Dice Masters veteran or someone looking to jump into the game fresh! A Team Pack can be paired with any Campaign Box or Starter Set to give a player everything they need to build a highly focused team for thematic play!

With 24 cards and 16 dice, this release is perfect when you’re trying to enjoy everything Waterdeep has to offer!

—description from the publisher

Name: Ohio Valley Skirmish
Description:
Ohio Valley Skirmish 
is a miniatures table top wargaming rule set for simulating American Civil War combat.

This rule set is usable for armies from a single regiment to multiple corps per side.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: The Zhentarim Team Pack
Description:
Dice Masters is a global hit from WizKids that uses the proprietary Dice Building Game platform developed by Mike Elliott and Eric M. Lang. The Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: The Zhentarim Team Pack will help you bring the Black Network to the tabletop!

The Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: The Zhentarim Team Pack features some of the most iconic Zhentarim from Waterdeep, including Manshoon, Istrid Horn, Ziraj, and several characters making their very first appearance in Dice Masters!

The Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: The Zhentarim Team Pack will let players build their own team of Zhentarim! The Dungeons & Dragons Dice Masters: The Zhentarim Team Pack is perfect for the Dice Masters veteran or someone looking to jump into the game fresh! A Team Pack can be paired with any Campaign Box or Starter Set to give a player everything they need to build a highly focused team for thematic play!

With 24 cards and 16 dice, this release is perfect when you’re trying to enjoy everything Waterdeep has to offer!

—description from the publisher

Name: New York Slice: Favorite Topping
Description:
Favorite Topping* - Worth +1 PT for every slice of the type you've eaten the most of.

Given out during the 2019-2020 New York Slice convention tournament series.

Name: Sgt Ligloo: Règle d'escarmouches, période Napoléonnienne
Description:
Sgt. Ligloo: Napoleonic Skirmish Rules

For 20/28 mm

Each player controls one of more group of 7/12 men each.

Scale:
1 mini = 1 man
1 cm = 1 m
1 turn = 1 min

— published in French

Name: Sgt Ligloo Goes To Hollywood!
Description:
Sgt Ligloo Goes To Hollywood ! is an expansion for Sgt. Ligloo covering the French intervention in Mexico and the American Civil War.

For 15, 20, 25/28 mm miniatures

Each player controls one of more group of 7/12 men each.

Scale:
1 mini = 1 man
1 cm = 1 m
1 turn = 1 min

Name: Mochi Mochi Peach Cat Card Game
Description:
The Mochi Mochi Peach Cat Card Game is family boardgame. In the game, the players will playing cards at the same time, the winner is who can grab more game cards.

The rules of the game are very simple and suitable for playing with children.

One set game include 72 cards and 1 rule sheet.

—description from the designer

Name: Destinies: Bound By Fate
Description:
In Bound by Fate you'll be joined by a fellow player, forming a team and sharing a common Destiny. Together you will fight against time and a second pair of players. Play smart, and share quests and items to explore the world faster than your opponents. The team that manages to cooperate better and fulfill their Destiny faster wins.

The Bound by Fate add-on allows you to experience all scenarios from the Destinies base game, Sea of Sand expansion, and Myth & Folklore expansion in a new 2 vs 2 game mode. It does not add any scenarios but contains the physical elements you need to play with a 4th player.

Name: Destinies: Sea of Sand
Description:
Embark on an epic journey to reach the sands of Mahdia, a pirate fortress on the shores of North Africa! Is your army strong enough to break through its walls? Or will the African heat, merciless pirate raiders, and the Ifrit, a creature of Arabic legend, see your dreams of glory sinking into the sea of sand forever?

The Destinies: Sea of Sand expansion comes with three scenarios that form a campaign that should be played in the suggested order. We recommend playing the whole campaign with the same group of players, but this is not mandatory. Scenarios are linked together, and each unveils the next steps of a bigger plot, but each scenario is a separate story, and knowing previous scenarios should not give a player any unfair advantage.

Sea of Sand also adds new dungeon and maze mechanisms, alongside the use of "sub-maps" to represent the vast distances of the Saharan desert and the locations players will visit.

Name: Destinies: Myth & Folklore
Description:
Expand your game and challenge yourself with three new scenarios for Destinies! The Myth & Folklore expansion lets you visit amazing historical sites and stand against mythical creatures: the Gargoyle, Doppelganger, and Melusine.

The Myth & Folklore expansion adds three new scenarios, 12 small minis, 2 medium minis, and 1 big Gargoyle mini alongside a slew of new map tiles, Destiny cards, and item cards.

Publisher note: The Myth & Folklore expansion does not come with a rulebook despite the content list on the back of the box.

Name: Gold River: Bandit Promo Card
Description:
A promo card distributed at the Festival international des jeux (FIJ) in Cannes.
Rule: Roll the dice. Count the number of players indicated by the sum of the two dice, clockwise and from the player on your left, and steal two nuggets from the player thus designated. If it falls on you, you lose two nuggets.

Name: Camp Out
Description:
Camp Out is a family-friendly, camping-themed, card game for ages 8 and over.

Camp Out consists of 84 playing cards. The object of the game is to collect 3 sets of non-identical camping item & activity cards, from the same category, in order to “Camp Out.” The camping items and activities span six categories, which include the campsite itself, food & drink, wildlife, hiking & fishing, things at the beach, and play and relaxation.

As you play Camp Out, Match Cards help your hand, and a set of six ‘game-changer’ cards called “Trail Mix.” Trail Mix cards can help or hinder your game play, depending who plays them, and how and when they are played. For instance, the “Avalanche” Trail Mix card can be used to make all players shift three of their cards to their left, or the player holding the card can choose to not enforce it. With another Trail Mix card called “Cherry Picking,” a player gets to dig into the discard pile for the right card, which will help their hand. With another Trail Mix card, “Leap Frog” makes the players to either side of the one holding the card exchange two cards simultaneously.

The way in which this “pickup & discard” game plays out, includes a playing feature both near the end, and at the end of a round, which gives Camp Out its name. When a player is one turn from possibly going out, they signal the other players by announcing their status with the word “Camp.” They do this not only to alert others, but also in order to garner 3 “Camp” points, which they would not get if they go out, or “Camp Out,” on their following turn.

The final playing feature, which can actually give the remaining players an edge over the winner of the round, is the choice of a final card draw, which they are not allowed to discard.

Final card hands are scored in various ways, depending on their makeup.

—description from the designer

Name: BTW: La Guerra
Description:
La Guerra is the lead game in the Between the Wars game series.

Currently in development, the game will have at least 4 countersheets (and probably more), 3 map segments, a very pretty box and the usual TKC refinements, ranging from a cut down TSWW rules set to lovely shiny dice.

Covering the Spanish Civil War, the game will include a grand campaign module, as well as a variety of learning scenarios and game modules, ranging from simple air missions to the Battle of the Ebro.

Name: TSWW: Liberation
Description:
Liberation is the TSWW Game covering the Western Allied liberation of Nazi occupied Europe.

Commencing in July of 1943, play to force Italy out of the war, and then stab into the “soft underbelly of Europe” or launch a hail mary assault in 1943 on the French Coast. Smash the Nazis in France and drive deep into Germany with a successful post Overlord breakout… Can you hang on long enough in the West to defeat the Western Allies and possibly free up enough firepower to save the Reich? Doubtful – but its the only hope for a Germany on the verge of collapse in 1944….

With 14 maps, and a minimum of 5600 counters (quite probably more – the RAF alone will be 2 sheets, as will the Royal Navy) over 20 sheets, Liberation finalises the first generation of TSWW Games in the West. Development is at an advanced stage, with only USAAF and USN OBs to be researched, along with the Repubblica Sociale Italiana which is already part researched.

Map art is at an advanced stage, relying as it does on the heavily revised mapping for Mare Nostrum, Barbarossa and Blitzkrieg II.  Art snippets will appear in due course in our Blog!

The various modules and scenarios will commence with small learning ones designed to ease your way into the TSWW system with minimal fuss, and will progress through smaller modules handling the invasion of Sicily (Operation Husky), the Gothic Line, and Anzio, then into France via Overlord and Neptune, Avalanche (the invasion of the South of France) finally concluding with the Wacht am Rhein and the final breakouts into the depths of Nazi Germany for the land aficionados out there, along with the strategic bombing campaign undertaken by the RAF and USAAF against the Reich for those of you who must fly everywhere!

Major campaigns will include Italy, North West Europe and of course the usual massive Grand Campaign module handling the entire Western Allied liberation of Europe.  
You too can be Patton or Montgomery on the one hand, or Von Rundsted or Kesselring on the other.

Space permitting Liberation will also include a major what if campaign designed to explore Winston Churchill’s desired approach to Germany… through the Ljubljana gap and into Southern Germany, heading off the Soviet advance from the East, and fulfilling the promise made by Chamberlain to defend Poland…
Families: Series: The Second World War (Diffraction Entertainment)

Name: TSWW: I Shall Return
Description:
I Shall Return, researched and developed by Dennis Dubberley who is a global expert on the campaign, is the TSWW game dealing with the Philippines Campaigns during The Second World War. Commencing with the Japanese attacks on the US forces in the Philippines in December of 1941, I Shall Return ends with the Japanese Surrender in August of 1945.

With 10 maps at 15 miles to the hex, as well as strategic mapping as necessary, 12 countersheets and a very pretty box showing General Douglas MacArthur striding ashore as he returned to the Islands as promised, I Shall Return fills in the gap between Day of Infamy and Singapore in the game mapping, and concludes the early war period in the Pacific Theatre (excepting China of course).

As ever, within the box will be a slew of learning scenarios, game modules and the Grand Campaign, with everything from the fall of Corregidor to the mammoth naval battles surrounding the Leyte Gulf Landings, I Shall Return provides a one box solution to the the Philippines campaign.

Dennis has also asked us (which we have agreed with alacrity) to include the projected US invasion of Formosa (Taiwan) in the game box… as usual the what ifs just keep coming with TSWW!

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: The Second World War (Diffraction Entertainment)

Name: Office Decathlon
Description:
It’s time to PLAY outside the box with Office Decathlon - a series of Olympic-inspired physical and mental challenges where you can show the office who’s boss!

Choose from events like Office Chair Bobsled, Coffee Cup Relay or Pencil Javelin for team building, icebreakers and pure enjoyment!

Individual players or teams compete in 10 different events using everyday office supplies.  Each event is scored and the overall first, second and third place winners are draped in gold, silver and bronze medals in an award ceremony - creating podiums and playing patriotic background music is highly encouraged!

—description from the publisher

Name: TSWW: Operation Watchtower
Description:
Operation Watchtower is the all encompassing operational game covering The SW PAC theatre of WW2.

Commencing with the 1941-42 Japanese drive to the South West, aimed at cutting Allied supply routes to Australia, the game continues through the desperate US led counter attack at Guadalcanal and the Australian troops clinging on for their very existence at Port Moresby through the climactic and bloody naval battles in the Coral Sea, Bismarck Sea, The Eastern Solomons and in Iron Bottom Sound, to the eventual Allied drive north towards the Japanese bastion at Rabaul.

The game will ship with 12 countersheets (3360 counters), covering all the forces involved in the campaign from start to bloody finish… It fits between Day of Infamy and Singapore!, and links directly to both of these titles, as well, of course, as I Shall Return and the final TSWW Pacific series title Kamikaze….

With 21 new style maps, with the same exceptional plasticised finish as Operation Merkur, the game will include New Britain, New Guinea, The Solomon Islands, Truk, and Noumea on map. As usual the maps will split enabling you to enjoy the game in parts as well as on the large combined map area. It is likely that additional Strategic Mapping will enhance your play further – watch the updates on the blog for more as the game moves towards completion!

Orders of Battle will include the usual TSWW refinements, including modules for the major land and naval battles, a variety of what if options and so forth.

Rules and charts will be to the normal TSWW standard.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: The Second World War (Diffraction Entertainment)

Name: TSWW: Kamikaze
Description:
Kamikaze is the last TSWWV1 Series Title

With a minimum of 12 Counter sheets (and probably 16 – this is going to be a BIG game) and 20-22 map sheets (14-18 15 mile maps, 2-4 strategic maps) the game picks up the NPAC and CPAC campaigns right were Day of Infamy leaves off.

The campaign starts in November of 1943 with the initial landings on Makin and Tarawa, moving through the Marshall Islands to the Marianas and finally the invasion of Okinawa in 1945.

Additionally the game will include Operation Downfall – the proposed invasion of Japan which will presume that the A-Bomb programme was retained as a last resort (or was late)….

Clearly we will include various learning scenarios plus a variety of modules in the game covering the key elements of the long hard drive towards the Japanese home islands as well, plus some what if items as they are developed.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: The Second World War (Diffraction Entertainment)

Name: TSWW: The China Incident
Description:
—Description from the publisher:

Commencing in 1937 and ending with the official end of the Chinese Civil war in 1949 the game will be designed to link into the BTW “Korea” game… as well as the PTO titles of TSWW, and as such is going to be a monster game to be matched by few others.

In the really rather pretty box will be a variety of delectable components for your perusal and play! These include:

     25 maps [Note that TSWW maps are smaller than standard size] covering most of Mainland China, bits of Machuria <sic> and the Eastern USSR, plus parts of Korea and areas of the Japanese home Islands.
     20 counter sheets. On these will be a full Nationalist, Communist and Warlord Chinese OB with the best research into these forces we can assemble, plus snap shots into the Soviet OB up to 1941, and then a full Soviet PTO OB to fit in with Barbarossa and Vengeance. Western Allied forces are likely to be limited at least in the first instance during research to the assets deployed to China – so the flying tigers, USAAF assets for the most part. 


We will also put together the 1944-49 or 50 US intervention OB for ground forces and if space permits may impose upon the team to concoct a what if USA Invades China optional OB. Space will be at a premium with 5-700 Chinese “divisions” to contend with! Optional Chinese forces will be provided to illustrate the difference in capability ownership of a land route – preferably from a port with a rail line would have made to the Chinese forces in the field.

     TSWW System rules – including the rapidly to become infamous “you are a drug dealer” rule…. Without specific areas of China both sides struggled for money as these areas were the prime Opium growing zones. In addition a series of corruption rules and “cross forces” trading systems will also be worked out to show how the Chinese and Japanese essentially co-existed for extended periods of time. There are a few other things we want to show – but they can remain secret for a while!
     Grand Campaign Chinese, Japanese, Western Allied OBs.
     At Start book. In this there will be a slew of modules – ranging from small scale things to teach you how to play the game to major operations ranging from the capture of Shanghai, the assault on Nanking, Nomonhan/Khalkin Gol, Suixian-Zaoyang, Changsha, Guangzi and Zaoyi; the Manchurian Strategic Offensive Operation, and then the key elements of the Chinese civil war. We hope to provide 20 or so modules and scenarios in the box which I think is a good target.
     Charts
     UIC
     Dice – the usual 2 x D10s…
     A very pretty box.
Families: Series: The Second World War (Diffraction Entertainment)

Name: Antesignani: Règles de jeu avec figurines pour batailles antiques
Description:
Antesignani is a miniature wargame ruleset for the Ancient-Medieval period.
It favors playability, reduction of litigious cases and adaptability to all types of basing, minis scales and play area.

Antesignani est une règle pour la période antique/médiévale privilégiant la jouabilité, la réduction a minima des situations litigieuses, et l’adaptabilité à tous types de soclage, d’échelles et de surface de jeu.

Name: Family Quiz: The Game of Classic Family Fun
Description:
The appointed Quiz master picks 8 categories from 10 in the main section and 10 questions from 2 of the mini categories giving a total of 100 questions.

The game is played in sections with a joker being used to get double points for the round. a score board is provided to keep tally.

—user summary

Name: Don't Wake Oscar!
Description:
"Don't wake Oscar the Grouch" is the name of the game in which players collect rubbish from the playground while Oscar snoozes in his bin.

Playing as Big Bird, Cookie Monster, Elmo, and Count von Count, players try to fill their rubbish bin before a pop-up plastic figure of Oscar the Grouch pops out of his trash can.

Young children will delight in this game of color matching, shape sorting and suspense as they try to be the first to fill their bin. But beware, if Oscar awakes during a player's turn, back the rubbish goes until the next turn.

The first child to fill his bin is the winner.

Name: Watch with Mother: Board Game
Description:
A fun- filled race and collect game featuring delightful colour puzzle pictures of those old Watch with mother favourites; The flowerpot men, Andy pandy, The woodentops and Rag Tag and Bobtail.

The game is simple yet fun to play and introduces colour, shape and number recognition to younger people.

—description from the back of the box

Name: Doin' The Most
Description:
Doin' The Most is a creativity based competition with a drinking aspect to make it funnier and weirder as you go.

The judge rolls the dice and draws from 1 of 3 corresponding decks (verbal, physical, crazy). Every card has a different challenge and one by one, each person competes to impress the current judge. The funniest/best player wins the card, while everyone else drinks. The judge duties then rotate to the left and the process repeats. The first player to five cards wins the game.

DTM is like a combination of Scattergories, Balderdash, charades, short-form improv, and King's Cup.

—description from the designer

Name: Munchkin: Black Friday Pack
Description:
Game description from the publisher:

Our retailers have helped make Munchkin a Black Friday staple for years . . . it’s time for us to return the favor!

This kit contains 10 packs of Black Friday-themed Munchkin cards. Give them as promos to your loyal customers, offer them as cheap add-ons to drive Munchkin sales, or leave them sitting on the counter for anyone to grab - it’s up to you!

If you would rather just put them out for sale and let your customers give the packs away as gifts, you can do that, too.

Key Features:

     New Munchkin cards that won’t appear anywhere else!
     Black Friday’s always tough - let us help.
     Throw a pack into your Munchkin demo set for some extra chuckles!


—description from the publisher

Name: Mechanical Revolution
Description:
A battle card game for 2+ players where robotic armoured combat suits fight for supremacy. Use Mechanics to upgrade, fix and modify your combat suit. Then use your Weapons and Equipment to overcome your opponents Shields and damage them until they have no Health Points remaining.

Mechanic cards are used as manna but rotate to provide other options for deployment.

Name: Seacom
Description: Seacom is a game of naval conquest for 2 players, that combines elements of popular deckbuilding and dueling card games with a strong focus on balanced gameplay and heavy interaction. The winner is decided by reducing your opponent's supply points to 0. There are many ways to achieve this, but the path you choose is your own.

Name: Fate of the Elder Gods: Cerulean Tendril
Description:
Single card promo sponsored by Unpub.
Allows you to roll one die and apply an effect based on the result.
Families: Game: Fate of the Elder Gods
Organizations: Game Designers of North Carolina

Name: Dino Hatchers
Description:
Dino Hatchers transports you to the prehistoric continent of Pangea on your quest to retrieve a rare species of stolen dinosaur egg!

On your journey, you will befriend many dinosaur companions each with unique skills and abilities who will assist you on your quest!

Avoid the many traps that litter your path whilst eluding the gaze of the dreaded MADmatician, or you'll be Dino chow in no time!

Dino Hatchers is a 2-4 player game, lasting between 30-45 minutes. The game consists of mild strategy, and is suitable for players upwards of 8 years old. The game requires a smart device - the centrepiece of the board is a downloadable app, available from the Apple App Store or Google Play Store.

—description from the publisher

Name: Down To Hell: The Board Game
Description:
Down To Hell is a board game that faithfully reproduces popular hack and slash video games. It offers a wide variety of mechanics well known from other board games. The game can be played in cooperative mode, as well as in solo mode. In this game heroes fight against evil who have invaded their land.

There are four hero classes, each of them are distinguished by specific attacks, spells and other abilities. There are multiple ways to carry out the skills of your hero throughout the game. Specific skillsets can be more suitable for fighting against players or monsters, the choice is yours.

Fighting against a boss is about guessing the boss's next move and planning your next move accordingly. A player with the lowest priority token can see the next boss action card, which is a compensation for being attacked first. Each of the bosses has a unique set of skills, there is a big reward for each of them.

—description from the publisher

Name: Gran Chaco 1932/1935
Description:
Gran Chaco 1932/1935 is a regimental scale Miniature wargame rules for the War of the Gran Chaco between Bolivia and Paraguay from 1932 to 1935.

For 15-28mm miniatures.

Gran Chaco 1932/1935 est une règle de jeu avec figurines pour la Guerre du Chaco (1932/1935) opposant la Bolivie au Paraguay.

Name: Braves Bataillons: règle Second Empire
Description:
Braves Bataillons: règle Second Empire is a Regimental scale Miniature wargame ruleset for the French Second Empire from the Crimean War to the Franco-Prussian War. In French

For 10-28mm miniatures.

Braves Bataillons: règle Second Empire
Règle de jeu avec figurines pour le Second Empire, de la Crimée à la Guerre de 70

Name: Oak & Iron: Ships of the Line
Description:
This expansion includes 3 plastic ship models. 
Including:
        1st Rate Ship of Line
        2nd Rate Ship of Line
        3rd Rate Ship of Line
    3 clear plastic ship bases
    3 ship cards
    All necessary tokens and counters.

—description from the publisher

Name: Oak & Iron: Gentlemen of Fortune
Description:
This expansion includes 3 plastic ship models. 
Including:
        Petit Frigate
        Corvette
        Sloop
    3 clear plastic ship bases
    3 ship cards
    All necessary tokens and counters.
Note: A copy of the Core Set is required to use these ships in Oak & Iron

—description from the publisher

Name: Oak & Iron: Men of War
Description:
This expansion includes 3 plastic ship models. 
Including:
        4th Rate Ship of Line
        5th Rate Frigate
        6th Rate Frigate
    3 clear plastic ship bases
    3 ship cards
    All necessary tokens and counters.

—description from the publisher

Name: Oak & Iron: Merchant Men
Description:
This expansion includes 3 plastic ship models. 
Including:
        Light Galleon
        Fluyt
        Brigantine
    3 clear plastic ship bases
    3 ship cards
    All necessary tokens and counters.
—description from the publisher

Name: Oak & Iron: Blackbeard's Revenge
Description:
This expansion includes 2 plastic unique named ship models. Including:
        Queen Anne’s Revenge
        Revenge
    2 clear plastic ship bases
    2 ship cards 
    1 Stede Bonnet captain card
    All necessary tokens and counters.

—description from the publisher

Name: Glimstone Grab
Description:
A cooperative game for 1-4 players. Much Middling is an average place, except for the special gems (glimstones) in its forest. Children love to play with these but unfortunately, a group of trolls has settled into a glade there. They love the glimstones too and have been snatching the children for lunch. A wizard recruits Esmeralda, from the Hoard game, as he knows of her reputation stealing treasure from a dragon and hopes to put her skills to use to benefit the community.
The wizard and Esmeralda set off in opposite directions, collecting glimstones which can be used to ransom snatched children and buy time. When they meet again, if they have the right combination of glimstones, they can perform a spell to banish a troll. They must banish all the trolls to win, but if a player ends their turn and all children have been taken, the players lose.
Players use movement cards to move the characters between the gems; it is possible to plan sequences of movements to get the characters to align again. Before each player's turn, an event card reveals if a child has been snatched or other forest inhabitants, some friend and some foe to the players, have been active that turn.

—description from the publisher

Name: Billy Yank II: Brigades de Fer – Règle pour figurines ACW à l'échelle de la Brigade
Description:
System allowing players to handle about 10 Brigade level units each, a force equivalent to an Army Corps.

This system is compatible with the use of hexagons maps.

Name: Salo Helenica Juego de Mesa Mitos y Leyendas
Description:
Board game adaptation of the entire classic Helenica set of Mitos y Leyendas (Myths and Legends CCG)

This limited edition game has all necessary accessories (playmats, coin, hourglass) to have a 2, 3 or 4 player game based on the 20 year old strategy collectible card game. This version has all 340 cards from the Helenica era.

Name: Salo Espada Sagrada Juego de Mesa Mitos y Leyendas
Description:
Board game adaptation of the entire classic Espada Sagrada set of Mitos y Leyendas (Myths and Legends CCG)

This limited edition game has all necessary accessories (playmats, coin, hourglass) to have a 2, 3 or 4 player game based on the 20 year old strategy collectible card game. This version has all 340 cards from the Espada Sagrada era.

Name: Salo Dominios de Ra Juego de Mesa Mitos y Leyendas
Description:
Board game adaptation of the entire classic Dominios de Ra set of Mitos y Leyendas (Myths and Legends CCG)

This limited edition game has all necessary accessories (playmats, coin, hourglass) to have a 2, 3 or 4 player game based on the 20 year old strategy collectible card game. This version has all 340 cards from the Dominios de Ra era.

Name: Dicetopia: Crashing Waves
Description:
Crashing Waves is the final expansion for Dicetopia that introduces a new unsettling dock area with three new locations adding more strategies and possibilities! Visit the Crashing Waves Stock Exchange to manipulate the value of dice resources. Break out a fellow thug from Cutthroat Prison for an extra turn and a stronger area control presence. Or drop by the Molotov Market to trade dice values!

You’ll also find more fishy factions, a rebalance of the original city board, as well as full support for an extra player, making Dicetopia go up to whopping 6 players together with the Roll with the Punches Expansion!

—description from the publisher

Name: Age of Steam Deluxe Expansion: Detroit Bankruptcy & Heavy Cardboard Maps
Description: Includes: a 2 sided game board with the Detroit Bankruptcy and Heavy Cardboard maps in the new Age of Steam: Deluxe graphic style.

Name: Ram Knuckle
Description:
You are the manager of a futuristic vehicle racing team and must win the hearts of the public assisted by your mechanic robots and your pilot. It is a workers placement with race management and vehicle improvement while managing the chaos of combat between players.

In a turn, you have 2 actions. You must move your vehicle and your second action may be to place a worker, make another movement or use your weapon.

The workers have various possibilities like going to get parts to improve your vehicle, entertaining the crowd to increase your glory, repairing your vehicle, stealing parts from other players and many others.

There is a system for hitting between vehicles and hitting robotic workers on the track.

The game ends when the first player finishes his third turn on the track. After, each player plays his last round.

The final scoring is done by counting the points of glory accumulated in each round, end of game objectives, each point not accumulated counts for half and finally, each 2 pieces count for 1 point.

There are several mechanics in this game. There is a part making charter. Glory points are accumulated by interacting with other players and you must also manage the race and the workers placement.

—description from the designer

Name: Haste Worte? Das Kartenspiel
Description:
Find three matching words as quickly as possible for a category and two specific letters. But be careful: If your teammates have written down the same words, you will unfortunately have to delete them and you will not get any points!

—description from the designer

Name: Somewhere In The Heavens…They Are Waiting
Description:
Explore the heavens for technology that will destroy the asteroid called “Wormwood” before it reaches Earth.

Somewhere In The Heavens… They Are Waiting is a fully cooperative, action-adventure experience based on the beloved Mac computer game "Marathon", for 2 to 6 players.

It’s the year 2155 and a large asteroid is headed toward Earth. It’s estimated that the asteroid, dubbed Wormwood, will reach earth’s atmosphere in 24 days. Meanwhile, you are an officer aboard the Gryphon, an AI controlled space cruiser, when your employer alerts you of your next mission. It sounds simple enough. A standard security check on an abandoned nuclear power facility. You will slowly uncover truths that connect to the fast approaching artifact.

Players will use an action point system to navigate through space finding the necessary technologies needed to stop the asteroid. One player will play as the ship A.I., Gabriel, using a web app to guide the 1-5 Officer players on planetary missions to accomplish the goals necessary to win. Officer players will acquire suit armor upgrades and weapons upgrades to fight against the threats attempting to keep the asteroid on its course. Missions will take you through space to industrial facilities, military strongholds, and alien architecture.

—description from the designer

Name: OMEGA: The Ritual
Description:
OMEGA is a strategic game, revisiting in an original way the theme of secret societies.
You play as an apprentice who is trying to join a mysterious organization known as OOTO. For this, you will have to summon the Ancient Spirits to discover the Arcana of the Omega. So, when the ritual ends, the Disciples will decide which apprentice is worthy to join them...

In a Game of OMEGA, you engage in an occult ritual at the end of which will
be designated the new Initiate of the brotherhood. You will summon Spirits with Runes. These Spirits will guide your progress on the Ritual disc in order to access the Arcana.
The first candidate to reach the number 7 Arcana will end the Ritual. Spirits, Runes and Arcana have special powers. You will have to learn to handle them and combine them to hope to be chosen.
There will be many strategies that can lead you to victory, but when you appear before the judges, be sure to have by your side powerful Arcana and, if possible, enough runes to best satisfy each of your Spirits...

Name: La Spedizione Perduta
Description:
(Note: This listing covers only the compilation versions of The Lost Expedition that include both the base game and the expansion, plus all (currently) released promos; for a listing of the expansion-only versions, go to The Lost Expedition: The Fountain of Youth & Other Adventures).

Legendary explorer Percy Fawcett marched deep into the Amazon in search of El Dorado. He was never seen again. Your team has gone in search of him, but now you hope to escape the jungle with the greatest treasure of all: your life.

Make the best of your food, your ammunition, and your health in The Lost Expedition as you plunge deep into the jungle. Choose your path carefully to ensure you're ready for the pitfalls that may occur. Play solo or cooperatively to survive the expedition, or play in teams to see which group can escape the jungle first.

The Lost Expedition: The Fountain of Youth & Other Adventures expands the base game with four new, modular additions.

In The Fountain of Youth & Other Adventures, Francisco de Orellana and his band of conquistadors traveled deep into the Amazon and were never seen again. Centuries later, unbelievable reports of men clad in ancient armor armed with sword and arquebus have surfaced. If the rumors are true, de Orellana found the Fountain of Youth and guards it dearly...

Other reports have emerged from the area of a mysterious mountain deep in the jungle, pulling planes crashing down from the sky. There are whispers, too, of a dark curse that the locals call only the Mark. For those foolhardy enough to still journey into the depths of the continent, they best not travel alone.

—description from the publisher

Name: Boom! Roasted
Description:
A party game where you roast your friends.

BOOM! Roasted begins with each player drawing 7 cards from the top of the deck in the “Roasts” pile. The youngest player in the group assumes the role of the Honoree and gets the first verbal beating—take your medicine and shut up about it!

The remaining players serve as the Roasters for the round, while the Honoree draws a “Setups” card and reads the set-up aloud beginning with their own name, and ending with “Roast Me.” Each Roaster then chooses the “Roasts” card that best corresponds with the setup and hands it face-down to the Honoree, who then shuffles the responses.

After shuffling, the Honoree inserts their first name while re-reading aloud the “Setups” card in conjunction with each of the “Roasts” cards, and chooses the funniest or most clever combination. The Roaster responsible for the best burn must point their finger at the Honoree and say, “Boom! Roasted” and is awarded the Setups card, which counts as one point.

Twofers: On “Setups” card scenarios requiring two answers, place the “Roasts” card for your first answer on the bottom with the second answer on top so that it may be read by the Honoree in the order you intended.

Roasters will replace any card(s) used during the previous round; the Honoree from the previous round is now free to roast the shit out of the next person.

The person to the Honoree’s left is the next in-line to be trashed by their friends. The Roaster with the most “Setups” cards/points at the end of the game wins the coveted title of Roastmaster or Roastmistress.

This game is intended for entertainment purposes only. BOOM! Roasted is not responsible for any depression, lack of self-worth, wallowing pity, OR any therapist expenses incurred as a result of playing this game.

If you don’t know what a word in our instructions or deck of cards means, you must be the type of person who doesn’t know how to Google things.

Note: If you’re already an asshole before playing this game, our material is not intended to serve as a form of realistic hazing or degradation. In other words, don’t be a bullying dickhead to people in real life.

—description from the designer

Name: Castle Rooms
Description:
Will you be the most skilled castle builder in the kingdom?
Place room cards to grow your castle, but be careful!
The other builders could use dragons to block your construction!!!

PURPOSE OF THE GAME 
Be the most skilled castle builder in the kingdom. You will have to place the room cards of the castle by matching the stairs and the corridors of entry with those of exit of the previous card placed on the left.
The player who manages to put 10 room cards in a row wins first.

PREPARATION AND DEVELOPMENT 
For 4 players you have to use all 64 cards
For 2-3 players you have to remove 2 Dragons and 2 Knights of your choice

Shuffle the cards and deal 2 face down to each player, the remaining cards are placed in the center of the playing area to create the draw deck.
The player who last visited a castle begins the game and continues clockwise. During his turn, eachplayer draws 2 cards to add to his hand and creates his own row or row of room cards in front of him starting from the left and adding other cards only to the right of the previous one. Each player can play as many cards as he wants from his hand, the important thing is that to pass the turn he does not have more than 2 cards in his hand. If you have 3 or more cards in your hand you cannot pass the turn but you will have to play them until you remain with 2 cards or less. WARNING: if you have 3 or more DRAGON or KNIGHT cards in your hand and you cannot use them, they will be discarded until you have 2 cards in your hand.

CREATING A ROW OF ROOMS
The rows of rooms are created starting from the first card on the left and adding the other cards always to the right of the previous one, by matching the stairs and the entrance corridors with those of exit of the previous card, it is not possible to add cards to the left of the row. All room cards have two identical symbols, positioned on the top and bottom sides and are an HELMET and a couple of CROSSED SWORDS. When building a row of rooms, it is mandatory that all symbols face the same direction, therefore, if you start a row with the HELMET facing up, all the cards that make up the row must have the HELMETS facing up. If you have no cards in your hand that can be added to a row that you are building and you have more than 2 cards in your hand, then you cannot pass the turn, you will have to start a new row, always matching HELMETS and CROSSED SWORDS, therefore, if your first row has the HELMET symbol facing upwards, the row that you will build must have the same symbol facing downwards. There is no limit to the number of rows of rooms you can build.

USING DRAGON CARDS AND KNIGHT CARDS
DRAGON cards can be used against an opponent, during your turn they can be placed to the right of a row of rooms to block the construction, because from this moment the opponent cannot add ROOM CARDS on his own row. The KNIGHT cards instead must be used on their own row of rooms where a DRAGON card has been placed to remove it and be able to continue building on that row. Once played it must be discarded together with the removed DRAGON card, these cards can no longer be used.

WINNING THE GAME
The player who first creates a row of 10 ROOM cards wins the game. If the cards in the draw deck finish,and no one had made a 10-card row, in this case the player who made the longest row of rooms wins, if there is an equal merit, whoever has made the second longest row, if there is still a tie, will check the third and so on.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dream: Sogni e Incubi
Description:
Card game and strategy for 2 - 4 players from 8 years of age in which each player must complete their DREAM by creating a row of 6 cards with increasing numbers from 1 to 6, hindering opponents with the NIGHTMARE cards.
Can you complete your dream and make your opponents have nightmares?

OBJECTIVE OF GAME
Complete your Dream row by trying to obstruct your opponents with Nightmare cards.
The winner is the player who creates a row of 6 Dream cards, with an increasing numbering from 1 to 6, without holding any cards in hand.

SPECIAL CASES
When a player no longer holds any cards and there are no more cards on the deck, but in his row there are also Nightmare cards, the opponents can continue playing until they hold no cards in hand. The player with most Dream cards in his row wins.
In the event of a tie the winner is the one who has the most consecutive Dream cards in his row.

PREPARATION 
Shuffle the deck and deal out 4 cards to each player. The deck is then left in the centre of game area. The youngest player starts and the game proceeds clockwise.

PROCEDURE
During the game each player must choose between:
Taking one card from the deck and putting it in his hand 
Playing a card in his own row or in the row of an opponent
Players can hold up to 10 cards in hand.

—description from the publisher

Name: Bodyguard
Description:
Bodyguard is a card game in which a president, a bodyguard and  any number of assassins try to reach their goals over the course of several rounds. In each round, a different player plays the president.

The president wins by eliminating any assassin (or surviving by the end of the round).
The assassins win if they kill the president.
The bodyguard wins by rescuing the president.

The president deals the role cards to the other players, with one card remaining unassigned. Also, each player holds six hand cards. On a turn, a player can either play an action or a hit card. A player who has four different hit cards in front of them, is eliminated from the round (typically meaning the end of the round, unless the bodyguard is eliminated first). If the president receives the fourth hit card, the bodyguard can play three different hit cards to rescue the president. Afterwards, points are awarded and another round start, until each player has played the president once. Highest overall score wins the game.

Name: Nur keine Aufregung
Description:
Each player sets his 4 pawns on the starting spaces (1-4) of his color. Movement is determined by a die. On the roll of a 6 a pawn may be moved from a starting space. On spaces 1-9 pawns of the same color may not pass each other by.

On the red spaces pawns may be thrown out if a pawn of another color is arriving. Thrown out pawns are set on space 9 and the player has to pay 1 coin into the jackpot (2 coins if his pawn already stands on space 9). Pawns on yellow spaces are safe, but their player has to pay 1 coin to another player arriving with a pawn on the same space. Pawns of the same color may never stand on the same space, expect for space 9.

The first player to get his 4 pawns around the game board and back to spaces 1-4 wins the game and the jackpot.

—user summary

Name: Reise nach Jerusalem
Description:
Each player has an starting amount of 12 points and choses one of the available starting spaces. Movement is determined by a die.

If a player gets on a numbered space, he refers to the corresponding number near the border of the game board and follows the rules printed there. As a result he may lose or gain points.

If a player reaches an occupied space, he has to draw a trivia card About the history of Israel and answer the question printed there. If he answers correctly, he may advance 5 spaces. If he does'nt know the answer he has to go 10 spaces back and loses 10 points.

The first player to reach space 50 (Jerusalem) wins the game and is proclaimed major of Jerusalem. The player with the most points gets to be prime minister of Israel.

—user summary

Name: A Elegia do Pássaro da Morte
Description:
A Elegia do Pássaro da Morte (The Elegy of the Bird of Death) is an eleven card microgame. 6 double-sided cards contain verses of a poem, 4 are identity cards, and the last one is the death card.

The verse cards are shuffled and laid out in a column, forming a poem. Each player receives a character card. The poem tells about the characters' death, and the goal of the game is to manipulate the poem and escape death 4 times.

Each character card shows four combinations of verse card symbols, one combinatino on each side. Whenever each of these appears in the poem, all turned to the red card side, the player has escaped once, and then they turn their character card by 90 degrees to achieve the next sequence.

On a turn, can do three actions: they may move one of the last two poem cards to the first position in the poem, or flip the first card of the poem to the other side (which results in certain other cards to be flipped as well), or escape death by having the three necessary cards flipped to the red side.

The first player to escape death four times is the winner - everybody else dies.

The game is based on the novel O Réquiem do Pássaro da Morte by Andrio Santos. Although the poem is in Portuguese, the game itself is language independent.

Name: The Depressing Game
Description:
The Depressing Game is a social deduction game, where players take on the role of high school students who have to deal with depression on a daily basis

This game was designed by the students of Nanakuli High School, located on the west coast of O'ahu, Hawaii.

While understanding the serious of the topic, this card game is light and humorous, and uses satire to explore the sensitive subject.

Gameplay summary:

You are high school students interacting on campus. The happy players are attempting to find out who is the depressed player and bring them around to the realm of sunshine. The depressed player is attempting to infect the other players with a contagion of woe.

A the beginning of the game platers are dealt a hidden role.


     If you are secretly playing a Happy Role (weirdo) the last round must be won by a Happy Card.
     If you are secretly playing the Depressed Role (I feel for you) the last round must be won by a Depressing Card DR the last round ends in a tie.


On a turn:

     Each player selects 1 card from their hand and places it face down ... (thinking about rainbows)
     All players then say "HAPPY!" and reveal their cards simultaneously.
     A player wins the round and furthers their secret agenda by having the highest numeric value of all cards played. Tied numbers cancel each other out. 


The player who plays the highest number wins the round. All tied numbers cancel out and count as zero.

The winner of the round selects 1 action (A or B)

a)Take a card from the Tableau of Emotions (cards in the center of the table). Now take a card from your hand and place that card face up in the Tableau of Emotions.

b)Take a card from the Tableau of Emotions(cards in the center of the table). Now take a random card from another player's hand and place that card face up in the Tableau of Emotions.

The winner will gather all the cards just played. place them together face-down in a "Discard pile" and place that pile aside. Place all played cards in the Discard pile from now on. No players may look at the discarded cards during the game.

Continue playing cards round after round until each player is down to their last card. This is the round that counts for the game.

All players play their last card face down. Before flipping over their last card, all players reveal their Hidden Role.

Players flip over their last cards following the same rules. Except the winning card's type (Happy or Depressed) determines the winner.

—description from the designer

Name: Locke & Key: Shadow of Doubt
Description:
Join the Locke family and their friends as they explore landmarks in their new home of Lovecraft, MA. Find and use powerful keys, make powerful allies, and put together the pieces of the past. But beware - not everyone is who they appear to be! Demons may be hiding among the group, enacting their own devious plans. Shadow of Doubt is a race to root out the traitors before they can open the Black Door and unleash a horde of demons upon the world!

Based on the award-winning graphic novel Locke & Key by IDW Publishing, Shadow of Doubt is a light, snappy social deduction game that's dripping with theme.

—description from the publisher

Name: A Todo Vapor!
Description:
A Todo Vapor! (Full Steam!) is a party game which is played while engaging in other activities. Each player draws a character card that is either a suspect or an investigator. The suspects have a list of activities that they have to fulfill, while each investigator has two special abilities that they can each use once during the game.

Whenever an investigator believes that a suspect is doing an activity from their list, they can call out the suspect. If correct, the suspect may no longer use that activity to score. If wrong, the investigator loses one of their special abilities.

The suspects win if any of them manages to execute three of their activities. The investigators win if none of the suspects has enough undetected activities left.

Name: King and Ace Cricket
Description:
This is a two-player game with a standard 52 card deck where two players compete against each other in a simulated cricket match.

A coin flip decides who bats or bowls first and play begins by drawing six cards. The aim is to play a card that's higher than your opponents.

If the bowler's card is higher,  a dot ball or a wicket happens. If the batter's card is higher, the batter scores that many runs or causes a wicket. Otherwise if tied, there is an automatic dot ball.

The innings ends after a predetermined amount of overs, or ten wickets, then the players change sides. Standard cricket scoring rules decide who wins. A standard cricket scoresheet can be used to score the game.

The card values are Ace to 4 scoring one run, 5 to 7 scoring two runs, 8 scoring three, 9 to 10 scoring a four, Jack and Queen scoring a six, and finally, a King being a wicket, no matter who plays it.

—description from the designer

Name: Arkham Ritual: Mystery Card Promo
Description:
You may wish to use Mystery Card instead of one of the 4 Great Old One cards included in the game. If you choose to play with the Mystery Card, take all 4 Great Old One cards and set them aside separate from the normal deck of cards.

Mystery Card is exactly the same as other Great Old One cards. The round ends immediately if a Gate card is discarded, and a player is holding a Mystery Card in their hand. Skip the normal End of a Round and resolve the Mystery Card’s effect instead.

Mystery Card’s effect:

Take the 4 Great Old One cards set aside. Shuffle them face down and reveal one of the cards. Resolve the effect of the revealed Great Old One card.

Name: Color Match
Description:
The goal of players is to take the control of the spaces with the same colors.
This game is containing 12 tiles on which there are 3 color spaces and roads to connect the cells to gether  also there are 8 discs and these are contained of 2 colors(every 4 discs have the same color).
The board of the game is made by players through the game.
The place , direction and time of the insert tiles and discs  are important.
Each player should follow a Strategy which helps him to take  3 spaces with same color by his discs. For this reason he should use tiles and be careful about his rival Strategy .

Name: La Petite Mort: Goodie Bûcheron
Description:
A goodie tile for La Petite Mort, picturing a very clumsy lumberjack.
This tile is a character card played as a basic game tile, with the Darwin Arward weakness, and zero soul point.

Name: Coin Rugby
Description:
Coin Rugby is a dexterity game popular in Australia and New Zealand combining elements of Penny Hockey (aka Penny Football) and Shove Ha'penny. It is played on a rectangular table between two players with a single round coin (usually a 20 cent piece).

The table represents the field of play in a Rugby match, with the ends furthest from each other representing the try-lines. Players attempt to flick or shove the coin from one end of the table to the other in three moves. They begin their turn by placing the coin so that part of it overhangs the table at the end closest to them. They then hit it with the palm of their hand for their first move. If they shove the coin completely off the table, their opponent receives the coin and begins their turn as described. If the coin is still completely on the table after three moves their opponent begins their turn from wherever the coin ended up on the table. If however, the coin is shoved into a position where it partly overhangs the opposite end of the table, they may attempt to score a try. 
To successfully score a try, a player must flick the overhanging coin into the air and catch it with one hand. Doing so will score 5 or 4 points (as per Rugby Union or Rugby League). The player may then attempt to kick a conversion, which is worth 3 or 2 points respectively. Their opponent must form the shape of a rugby goal with thumbs and forefingers. This may be done in the air or with their fists on the edge of the table, at the behest of the scoring player, but this must be done fairly and without moving once set. Then the player attempting the conversion spins the coin on the table. To attempt the "kick" they must place both fists on the table beyond the spinning coin and then catch it between their thumbs. With the coin between their thumbs they must then propel it over the goal made by their opponent. Regardless of outcome the opponent then receives the coin and begins their turn. 
Play can be timed, end when a certain score is reached by one player, or end with a "mercy rule", i.e., an agreed points differential.

—user summary

Name: Dr. Smile
Description:
Dr. Smile is a one card microgame. The card shows eight facial expressions. One player plays the role of the evil Dr. Smile, who has locked up the players in metal cylinders so the only thing they can move is their faces. Dr. Smile secretly defines a sequence of three such expressions (or more, for a more challenging game).

Players stand in a a row in front of Dr. Smile and take turns making one of the expressions, with Dr. Smile moving his/her head when it is correct. From the second round onward, the second expression must also be guessed, and so on. The goal is to find out the complete sequence in order to escape from the evil doctor.

Name: Das Katzenspiel
Description:
Content: 36 picture cards, 2 dice

The picture cards have the shape of a sitting cat. On the back is a dice symbol with 1 to 6 die pips. The front shows one or more cats. Some cards show a bag or food or another motif.

At the begin of the game all cards are ordered by their dice symbol and each pile is shuffled. Then the players roll dice for to receive the top card of the corresponding pile until all cards are distributed. If a player rolls a die symbol, which does not have any cards left, they do not receive any card.

As soon all cards are distributed, the players turn their cards over. Each player needs a bag of food to feed their cats. If a player has no food they have to trade their card with the most cats with another player to receive a bag of food. The player with the cat king requires an additional bag of food. The player with the most cats wins the game. The cat king scores 7 points.

Name: Folclore
Description:
Folclore is a Mexican party game consisting of fourteen different cards (3 cards each, with 3 different colors). Each card has been illustrated by a different Mexican artist.

Each player has a set of hand cards. At the start of a round, there is a market phase in which players can trade with others by calling out color offers or requests, trading one card against one other card. Trading happens simultaneously. When one player has either only cards of one color in their hand, or a set of all three cards of a kind (in all three different colors), they win the round. The winner can hand out two of the cards they used to win the round to two other players as challenge cards. The challenges are written on the card and can either require the receiver to perform an action immediately, or to continue playing the game while speaking in a certain way, or other such handicaps. 
The winner of a round also claims tokens from the center of the table. When these run out, the game ends.

Name: Colorbugs
Description:
Each player takes up the role of a colorbug: Frida Kohlor, Vincent van Bugh, Salvabug Dalí or Pabug Picasso. They get a screen behing which they hide their objectives.

Primary color and picture tiles are shuffled and laid out face-down in a grid. Players take turns and can either
- flip open a tile
- put a ladybug token on an open tile
- mix two colors. For that, they point at two color open tiles without ladybugs and discard one of their objectives. The objectives are secondary and tertiary colors, and they can only be discarded if two colors needed to mix them are visible in the grid.
To claim a picture tile, players have to have their ladybug tokens on color tiles which are necessary for painting the picture.

The first player who gets rid of their three objective tiles and has placed three pictures in their gallery is the winner.

Name: Gloom: Game of Trades promo card
Description:
This is an Promo card for Gloom.

To play with this promo, shuffle it into the pile of cards at the beginning of the game.

The card's ability reads: "Choose 2 living characters. Swap their top modifier cards."

This promo was released in issue #237 of Game Trade Magazine. (1 of 4 possible)

Name: Constantinopla: El ocaso de un imperio
Description:
It is a game for a player that combines time progress with technological development and a simple military strategy system.

The objective of the game is to deplete the deck of chronological events and reach the year 1463 (last card of the deck) in possession of at least Constantinople. The game is lost if the player is not in possession any moment of Constantinople or if the emperor and all his heirs have died.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Es un juego para un jugador que combina avance temporal con desarrollo tecnológico y un sistema de estrategia militar sencillo.

El objetivo del juego es agotar el mazo de eventos cronológicos y llegar al año 1463 (última carta del mazo) en posesión al menos de Constantinopla. Se pierde el juego si el jugador no está en posesión cualquier momento de Constantinopla o si el emperador y todos sus herederos han muerto.

—description from the publisher

Name: Broken: The Card Game
Description:
Broken is a card game for 1-5 players. In the game you slip into the role of a publisher who sells board games on Kickstarter, and if possible does not deliver them. The golden rule is: having money comes from keeping money. So you play your cards in a way that buy the most profitable games possible and do not have to produce them. But be careful, because the other players have the same goal.

During the game, players take turns to play an excuse card that matches the card that is on top of the discard pile. The closer their card matches, the more money they get. Players can play sets of the same excuse to get greater rewards.

Name: Wolfheze
Description:
The game is named after Wolfheze, a village in the Netherlands. A part of Operation Market Garden happened in this area.

It consists of a game board printed on thin cardboard. In addition, players need 2d6, paper and pencil, and some markers and playing pieces.
On a turn, a player can choose between rolling the dice and flying. When rolling the dice, the player places a playing piece on a field marked with the resulting number. If that field is occupied, the current piece can be moved to an adjacent field. 
Instead of rolling the dice, a player can decide to fly, taking one of their stones off the board and placing it on any free field. 
When a vertical column is completely full, the player with most pieces in that column scores points. When a player has placed all their pieces on the board, there is a scoring round, and pieces on certain fields score positive (village fields) or negative (war fields) points. After the second such scoring round, the game ends and the player with most points is the winner.

Name: Quero-Quero
Description:
Quero-quero (Gimme-gimme) is a card game developed for small children, starting at 3 years old. The deck consists of 36 cards representing six Brazilian endangered animal species in six different colours with one to six animals per card.  As cards are displayed on the table, children need to associate cards by animal, colour or quantity in order to take as many cards as possible. When the deck runs out, the child with the biggest card collection wins the match. It is important that the child announce his/her move saying "gimme-gimme the panther", to take all panther cards; "gimme-gimme the blues", to take all blue cards; or "gimme-gimme the fours" to take all cards with four animals.
As the child grows, new rules add complexity to the game, making it more tactical, as the child receives objective cards. In that case, cards matching the objectives will give him/her extra points.

—description from the publisher

Name: 新幕 桜降る代に決闘を 達人セット (A Duel for Falling Cherry Blossoms: New Act – Master Set)
Description: An expansion to the Basic Set for A New Duel in the Fall of Cherry Blossoms, the Master Set includes new characters/cards as well as a new storage system.

Name: Band Is Horrible
Description:
This game is made for marching band students and directors.

Deal all players seven white answer cards. The player with the biggest ego goes first. While this is almost certainly the trumpet player, they are referred to as "The Judge." The Judge draws a blue question card and reads it to the other players. Players select the card in their hand that best answers the question. Cards are played face down and shuffled. The Judge reviews all the cards and selects the winner who holds onto the blue card for the remainder of the game.

Includes: 396 high-quailty cards in a rigid two-piece box.
Each set contains 6 blank answer cards to write your own smartass responses.

—description from the publisher

NOTE: Although the publisher says 12+ for this game, there are a handful of mature innuendo cards that may be removed for younger audiences.

Name: Kruiswoordspel
Description:
Kruiswoordspel is a game for "2 or more" players in which words are formed from 13 dice with letters on them. The slogan in English is "Fun With Letters". On each player's turn, they roll the dice using the provided cup, and try to form as many interconnected words as possible from the top-facing letters, before the provided sand timer runs out (approximately 4 minutes). Point values of the used letters are added up (double-counting any that are used in two words), and the values of any unused letters are subtracted. Any disputed words are settled by the player who went first, the "leader" - either by looking it up in a dictionary of his/her choice, or "deciding himself" whether to accept the word. After a "prearranged number of rounds", the player with the highest total score is the winner.

Differences from the more-well-known Scrabble Crossword Cubes game include:

     13 dice rather than 14
     different combinations of letters on them (e.g. all dice have a mixture of vowels and consonants on them, vs most of the vowels being together on four dice that have no consonants)
     different points values (e.g. F=3 vs 4, H=2 vs 4, K=4 vs 5, V=3 vs 4, X=6 vs 8)
     dispute resolution is not necessarily based on a standard dictionary
     types of words to be excluded are not specified
     Scrabble Crossword Cubes includes a second set of rules in which words of specific lengths must be spelled


—user summary

Name: Chicken Time Warp: Cluster Cluck Expansion
Description:
This expansion includes a new timeline with multiple Escape Window Open cards and the ability to travel forward in time.

—description from the publisher

Name: Triumph of the Temple
Description:
The artifact matching, jewel-winning quest!

“You’ve discovered an Egyptian pyramid filled with temple jewels and ancient artifacts that need repair. It’s up to you to fix them in order to be rewarded with the jewels of the temple. Your Quest Cards will tell you which artifacts you can fix on your turn. The player who collects the most jewels will be the one to triumph over the temple.”
—description from the rulebook

In this game, you have a hand of 3 tiles. you then draw a Quest Card from the deck and it will tell you which artifacts that are listed on the tiles will score you points that turn. Match up as many symbols on the cards as you can and you will get a jewel for each correct match. 
—user summary

Name: Newton's Tree
Description:
Get smart with Newton in this super fun game of balance and skill! Build newton’s tree by adding branches and keep it balanced as you add and pluck apples and move Newton around. Strategize and play your game cards wisely! Are you going to be the one to fumble? Remember…To the tree, quicker the tumble!

—description from the back of the box

Name: Smoosh and Seek Treehouse
Description:
The Mash It and Match It Memory Game!

“Ready, Set, Seek! The woodland friends are playing and and seek and don’t want the fun to end. Can you find them all before Mr. Prickles climbs the ladder to send them on their way? Take turns drawing tokens and working together to remember which animal is under which game shoosher. Then press the smooshed into the smoosh dough to see if you found the right one! Find all the animals and everyone wins!”
—description from the back of the box

Name: Horse & Musket: Annual #3
Description:
Horse and Musket Annual Number 3 is the third fan expansion to Horse & Musket. It will add new scenarios for owners of Volumes I-IV and Horse & Matchlock.

The scenarios include...

Thionville - June 7, 1639 – Piccolomini’s Pinnacle

Tippermuir - September 1, 1644 – “Jesus and no quarter!”

Bysjön - December 22, 1644 – Buttons for Bullets

Inverlochy - February 2, 1645 – “This disaster did extremely amaze us.”

Belgrade - August 16, 1717 – “Prinz Eugen der edle Ritter”

Piacenza - June 16, 1746 – The Salvation of Habsburg Italy

Reichenberg - April 21, 1757 – Bevern’s Finest Hour

Moys - September 7, 1757 – “I will never ever find again another Winterfeldt.”

Burkersdorf - July 21, 1762 – Frederick II’s Last Battle

Hubbardton - July 7, 1777 – The Rearguard Action that Saved the Revolution

Monmouth - June 28, 1778 – The Continental Army Comes of Age

First Savannah - December 29, 1778 – “…their retreat was rapid beyond Conception."

Kettle Creek - February 14, 1779 – John Boyd’s Loyalist Misadventure

Second Savannah    - October 9, 1779 – “Extreme bravery can conquer anything.”

Hobkirk’s Hill - April 25, 1781 – “Fortune has not been our friend.”

Amstelveen - October, 1787 – A Revolution Strangled

The Wabash - November 4, 1791 – St. Clair’s Defeat

Fallen Timbers - August 20, 1794 – “The Black Snake That Never Sleeps.”

Montenotte - April 11-12, 1796 – Bonaparte’s First Victory

Lodi - May 10, 1796 – “I felt the earth flee from beneath me...”

—description from the publisher
Families: History: War of the Austrian Succession

Name: Tramways: Adelaide / Shanghai
Description:
Tramways: Adelaide / Shanghai includes one large, 42cm × 60cm, 2-sided gameboard, folded into 4 sections, with a map of the Adelaide of the 1920s on one side, and a map of Shanghai on the other side. It also includes a A4 rulesheet that explains the rules differences, and the peculiarities of each map.

Both maps are illustrated by Todd Sanders, and these new maps will help highlight the depth of the game, while simulating construction in these two exotic cities, each with its own characteristics.

Shanghai Map special rules (1p-5p):

Players need to handle all along the course of game with a series of bad actions that affects each action.

The winner of the auctions will choose the less worst among:

Only build 2 Rail tiles
Only 2 actions instead of 3
Double destination icons requires
Increase again your stress by 2
No administration phase
Get no revenue from Passengers

Adelaide Map special rules (1p to 5p):

All industries on the Gulf St. Vincent are harbors and are virtually connected...
The big residence in the down town represent the high density of the city. If your citizens are living the down town to the suburb, you will get double revenue (Money), but if you move passengers to the down town, you do not get any revenue...
any double destination icons played is a wild action during your turn and replace any other actions...

Name: Riding to the Sea
Description:
Holding his head up for a flag of all the free, Love-light of Spain—hurrah! Death-light of Africa! Don Juan of Austria  iIs riding to the sea!

Riding to the Sea is an operational set of campaign rules for Cannon, Cross and Crescent fast play Renaissance naval rules.

The rules use an area movement system and an abstracted “Strength Point" system to represent port garrisons and troops engaged in amphibious operations; this can be replaced with troop stands for use with Renaissance land rules.

An example campaign setting based on the Aegean Sea is also included.

—description from the publisher

Name: Good Guess
Description:
Good Guess is the perfect casual party game for friends and families, for teams and individuals. It’s part riddle, part trivia and part just sound logical reasoning.

We love this trivia game because it stimulates more conversation than (dare we say) any game ever!

Clues come one at a time - the first team to guess correctly earns points. Use wild cards to pull a fast one on a leader who thinks they’re cruising to victory. With for ways to play ranging from fast-paced to highly collaborative, it’s a great addition to any dinner party, getaway, family evening or long car ride.

Our family created this game over 10 years ago after we couldn’t find a simple, fun and stimulating game to play in the evenings. We love it because it stimulates conversation, stories and all sorts of goodness that contributes rather than detracts from a great evening. We intentionally made the game play simple. We eliminated the need for game pieces, a game board, die and, of course, complicated instructions that bewilder and frustrate.

The clue cards are loaded with astonishing facts about everyday people, places and things that are certain to entertain. Our rule of thumb was: the clues needed to make the folks playing the game excited about guessing and learning the answer. Did you know, for example, that Harry Houdini died one week after being buried alive?

Name: The Black Rat
Description:
The plague has broken out in the city and all rats are struggling to survive.
Players play hand cards to activate new rats, to move them, to infect zones and to spread the plague. Rats which leave the city outskirts will yield immediately victory points while rats which remain in the city till the end will possibly earn more points, unless they become sick.
This easy and fast "family" game is all about risk management.

Free PnP version!

—description from the designer

Name: Alea Iacta Est: The Die Is Cast
Description:
Ancient Wargames Rules
      
Designed to cover the rise and fall of the Roman empire. These rules are especially suited to refights of historical battles. No, you don't have to rebase your figures. Yes, they play as fast as DBM. No, you won't have to buy new army list books, in fact you can use the armies you use for other rules. Included are morale rules so that bad troops run away, good troops hang around a bit longer. General figures don't fight but have command and combat ratings to inspire the troops that do. The rules are designed to encourage historical tactics.

—description from the publisher

Name: トラピジスタ (Trapezista)
Description:
The trick-taking game ãƒˆãƒ©ãƒ”ã‚¸ã‚¹ã‚¿ (Trapezista) was one of the finalists in the 2017 Trick Taking Party design competition in Japan.

In the game, players take on the role of trapeze artists and try not to fall or drop the other players. The game uses a subset of a standard deck of playing cards, including two jokers, and a board. The game is a standard "must follow" trick taking game, that incentivizes which players you win tricks before and after.

After four rounds, the player with the most points wins.

—user summary

Name: Волк, коза и капуста
Description: Seeing a goat, a wolf forgets a thunderstorm. And let the goat into the garden, he’ll wipe the whole cabbage. Enlist the help of a faithful shepherd and make sure that the wolves are fed and the goats are safe!

Name: Ανακύκλωσέ το
Description: Recycling is very important! In this game players roll dice and move their pawns around the city. During their movement they come across different kinds of litter which they have to put in the according recyling bin in order to be the first one to entirely fill up their own bins and win the game!
